isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CATERPILLAR C-10 AND C-12 ENGINES - OPERATION - Cruise Control

svcproc.title: Cruise Control
svcproc.para: The cruise control switches are used as idle controls when the vehicle road speed is not present (this is a customer selected parameter). Refer to the Operators Manual furnished with the vehicle for cruise control operating instructions. Refer to circuit diagram CATERPILLAR C-10 or C-12 - CRUISE CONTROL in CTS-5122W.

The cruise on/off switch is lighted to allow for easy location in the dark. Cruise on/off switch circuit 97AE is an input to the ECM at connector (1014) terminal 59. The ground side of the on/off switch is connected through circuits 97-GH, 97-GA, and 97-G to connector (1014) terminal 5. With the switch on, the ECM sees 0 volts at connector (1014) terminal 59. With the switch off, the ECM sees 5 volts at connector (1014) terminal 59.

The cruise set/resume switch is lighted to allow for easy location in the dark. Set/resume switch terminal 5 is connected to the ECM through circuits 97-GD, 97-GA and 97-G to the connector (1014) terminal 5. Set/resume switch Set terminal 4 is an input (circuit 97AB) to the ECM through connector (1014) terminal 35. Set/resume switch Resume terminal 6 is an input (circuit 97AA) to the ECM through connector (1014) terminal 44.
With the set/resume switch in the set position, the ECM sees 0 volts at connector (1014) terminal 35 and 5 volts at terminal 44.
In resume position, the ECM sees 5 volts at connector (1014) terminal 35 and 0 volts at terminal 44.
In the set/resume neutral position, the ECM sees 5 volts at both connector (1014) terminals 35 and 44.
